intro: Ceropegia tapscottii, commonly known as the tapscott's lion's tail, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and striking, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are often visited by specific pollinators, such as birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and attractive addition to specialized botanical collections.
